Calculate average loadings of each cluster

buildAvgLoading.Rd

Name of the input vector is principle component (pc) from different datasets (ds) and the integer is the cluster number assigned to each ds.pc. This function includes kmenas clustering, so set.seed before using this function for reproducible results.

buildAvgLoading(
  dat,
  k,
  n = 20,
  clustering = TRUE,
  cluster = NULL,
  iter.max = 10,
  seed = NULL,
  study = TRUE
)

Arguments

dat

A data frame. Each row represents principle components from different training datasets. Each column represents genes used for PCA analysis.
k

The number of clusters used for k-means clustering
n

The number of top principle components from each datasets used for model buildling. Default is 20.
clustering

Under the default condition (TRUE), Kmeans clustering will be done and you should provide k. If FALSE, you don't need to provide k, but should provide pre-defined cluster membership of your data through cluster argument.
cluster

Default is NULL. Provide pre-defined cluster membership of your data if clustering=FALSE.
iter.max

The maximum number of iterations allowed for kmeans
seed

A random seed
study

Under default (TRUE), studies involved in each cluster will be added in the output.

Value

A named list of 13 elements is returned if clustering=TRUE. It contains:

kmeans outputs

9 outputs from kmeans

avgLoading

A matrix of average loadings. Columns for clusters and rows for genes

k

The number of clusters

n

The number of top PCs used for clustering

studies

A list of character vector containing studies in each cluster

If clustering=FALSE, a named list of 6 elements is returned. It contains:

cluster

A numeric vector on cluster membership of PCs

size

A integer vector on the size of clusters

avgLoading

A matrix of average loadings. Columns for clusters and rows for genes

k

The number of clusters

n

The number of top PCs used for clustering

studies

A list of character vector containing studies in each cluster
